column4: hey there I'm having a weird hard disk problem. I am using lvm and one of the disks is throwing SMART errors. The drive is not detected in the BIOS but GRUB still loads from the MBR... seems odd to me.
and I installed GRUB on that disk
I bought a new hard drive and was going to clone the UUID to the new drive and just accept the data loss... but wanted to try to get some of the data back
yea.. but that drive isn't detected at all by ubuntu
hrmm... never used dd_rescue.. I'll check it out
yeah that's more like symantec ghost
is there a package for dd_rescue
hmmi thought there was... i'm sure you can find isntructions on google
ok.. compiled it.. hopefully it works
dd_rescue can't read a single block
well.. I'm sure it is since it threw a SMART error
you're sure it is a physical failure?

well here is what happened... I tried mounting a AFP share off the server and it died. the box pinged so I tried SSH'ing to it and the connection closed immediately.. I thought that was odd so I threw a monitor on it and saw the screen flooded with IO Errors.. I couldn't type a single character they were flying by so fast
hmmm... afaik that doesn't rule out the possibility of a phsyical problem like a head crash.  the drive spins up and everything, I assume?
yes.. and remember.. GRUB loads off one of the partitions
